name: Comprehensive Blood Biomarker Panel
description: Extended blood panel covering metabolic, hormonal, inflammatory, and organ function markers. Goes beyond standard annual bloodwork to include longevity-relevant biomarkers like insulin, hs-CRP, homocysteine, ApoB, and hormone panels.
mechanisms: Metabolic health assessment (glucose, insulin, HbA1c, lipids)
Organ function (liver, kidney, complete blood count)

dosage.notes: Best done fasting (12hr). Include: CBC, CMP, lipid panel + ApoB, insulin, HbA1c, hs-CRP, homocysteine, full thyroid, hormones, vitamin D, B12, ferritin.

keyFindings: Regular monitoring enables data-driven intervention optimization
ApoB superior to LDL-C for cardiovascular risk assessment
Fasting insulin is earliest marker of metabolic dysfunction
